item.title: Journal Archives
item.description:
When I was a kid in high school and college I loved the programming magazines of the time. I was just getting familiar with Unix systems, and hacking around on the campus AIX and Solaris systems. Sometime during my freshman year I discovered Linux and installed Slackware on a hard drive partition and have been hooked ever since.

I came across this DVD archive of several programming magazines from the time and I felt a need to preserve them here for posterity. Inside you can find:

item.title: Being Clever
item.description: I’ve been doing a lot of thinking about coding styles lately. One of the interesting things about the space that my firm plays in is that it attracts people that are technologically inclined but have not typically had prior coding experience. A lot of the folks come from accounting and finance backgrounds. As such, they don’t have the background in things like version control, CI/CD, code reuse and refactoring, or any sort of true development best practices.
